title: 'Robbed' Brendan Cole will make surprise X Factor: Celebrity return for final

Brendan Cole will be back on The X Factor: Celebrity for the live final - and hopes to be singing once again.

The former Strictly Come Dancing star tried to turn down a different path and forge a singing career with pal Jeremy Edwards.

But the professional dancer and ex-Hollyoaks actor failed to impress the judges with their vocals and were booted out after the initial auditions.

However, Brendan has told Mirror Online that the dynamic duo will definitely be back for a surprise appearance during the live final.

Speaking at last night's Pride Of Britain Awards, Brendan told us that the pair were "robbed" by the harsh udges.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: ITV)

The pro dancer cried: "Robbed, robbed!

"All of us on it had a great time and I had a ball. I'll be back for the final cheering the guys on.

"And hopefully we'll see some amazing things over the next few weeks."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

When asked whether Cole and Edwards would be singing on stage again, Brendan said he was in talks with X Factor bosses.

He added: "I'm pushing for it. I'll let you know."

Brendan also discussed switching channels from prime time BBC to rivals ITV.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Brendan had been a permanent fixture on Strictly since the first series in 2004 and won that year with partner Natasha Kaplinsky.

On switching to ITV, he said: "It was amazing being on the other channel. Obviously being on Saturday night live TV for 14 years was a massive part of my life.

"To be on the other channel, on The X Factor, I never thought I'd be saying that. It was a privilege and an honour. I love it."

(Image: PA)

Brendan also hit back at Strictly critics who blasted the controversial decision to send Catherine Tyldesley home.

He said: "The thing with Strictly is it's an entertainment show.

"I always says if you've been kicked out you haven't entertained. Even though I've cried sometimes when I've been kicked out and didn't think it was right.

"If you've been kicked out and weren't entertaining enough to get the vote, there's not point of you being there anyway."

(Image: BBC)

Brendan previously spoke about his shock Strictly departure earlier this year on ITV's Lorraine

He told Lorraine Kelly: "This is quite hard to talk about. The BBC haven’t renewed my contract – we get renewed year on year – and they made an editorial decision not to have me back on the show.

"I’m a little bit in shock. I’m quite emotional, a bit raw about it."

The professional dancer admitted it was not his decision to leave - and speculated it could be because he iss a 'strong character'.

He added: “I’ve always known this day would come. To get to this point, the BBC make the decisions year upon year. It’s an editorial decision.

"I’m sure I’ll never know the ins and outs. I’m a very strong character within the show, I have my strong views.”

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
description: EXCLUSIVE: The former Strictly Come Dancing star is pushing X Factor bosses after being ditched after the auditions
